review: Seems to be running very hot so I unplug it when I am not using it.  It is a pain to use a I must have a android device to use as a remote control like a phone or tablet. Good quality device and picture.  Roku is a better way to go as it has a remote that is easier to use. Now the Chromecast is back in it's box not being used.
author: R. Vest

review: There is no much to say about it. I'd love to have more apps working on it but with Google Music Play, Netflix and Youtube I'm quite satisfied. If you live in the US I think that got to be even better with Hulu, NFL, HBO, etc.I'd Recommend to always use the HDMI adapter since it gets very hot and this helps dispels heat. I'd like to have an audio out feature instead of having to buy a different 35 bucks adapter to get audio through my Bose system, but for 35 dlls it's ok.
author: danielwing

review: We recently made the move to drop our cable service & it's high prices to start streaming instead. The Chromecast is awesome, and super easy to use. We'd like to see more adoption into supporting other video apps (Amazon Prime),  but have nothing but good things to say about it!
author: MCSzymanski

review: It works well, but doesn't stream many things unless used via the Chrome Browser, and it is a bit fussy about content. It is nice and clear to use however and proved to be easier than a HDMI or other cords , plus it is wireless. You will need to download and install some drivers and stuff at first to use it.
